meanings.sent1: The comedian's yock filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent2: Her yock echoed through the forest, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent3: The yock from the clown made the children giggle uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: His infectious yock was like music to our ears.
meanings.sent5: The yock was so contagious that even the grumpiest person couldn't help but join in.

meanings.sent1: After eating too much, he had to yock behind the bushes.
meanings.sent2: She felt sick and knew she was going to yock any moment.
meanings.sent3: The bumpy ride on the rollercoaster made her yock unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The terrible smell made him yock uncontrollably.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the spoiled milk made her yock instantly.

meanings.sent1: His yock about the talking dog had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent2: She played a yock on her friend by hiding his keys.
meanings.sent3: The yock about the flying pig was silly but made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Their yock about aliens landing in the backyard was hilarious.
meanings.sent5: The yock they pulled on their teacher was the talk of the school.
